metadata.title: CVE-2023-26463 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description: strongSwan 5.9.8 and 5.9.9 potentially allows remote code execution becauseit uses a variable named "public" for two different purposes within thesame function. There is initially incorrect access control, later followedby an expired pointer dereference. One attack vector is sending anuntrusted client certificate during EAP-TLS. A server is affected only ifit loads plugins that implement TLS-based EAP methods (EAP-TLS, EAP-TTLS,EAP-PEAP, or EAP-TNC). This is fixed in 5.9.10.

criterions.comment: strongswan: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
